item.dc:creator: External
item.title: Joba, Yankees aiming to break BoSox hex

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Orlando Magic's Rashard Lewis suspended for failing drug test
item.description: All-Star forward Rashard Lewis of the Orlando Magic has been suspended without pay for 10 games for testing positive for an elevated testosterone level, the league announced Thursday.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Cleveland Browns receiver Donte' Stallworth apologizes, says he's caused 'irreparable harm' to family of victim and NFL
item.description: Donte' Stallworth said Thursday he has done "irreparable harm" to the family of the man he struck and killed, as well as the NFL, while driving drunk in March and will accept whatever punishment commissioner Roger Goodell has in store.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Padraig Harrington leads WGC-Bridgestone Invitational by two strokes
item.description: Padraig Harrington feels good enough about his swing to concentrate on his results, and it finally paid off in the Bridgestone Invitational with a 6-under 64 for a two-shot lead.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Boston Red Sox's David Ortiz, MLBPA plan Saturday news conference for 2003 drug test
item.description: Boston Red Sox star David Ortiz and incoming players' union head Michael Weiner plan a news conference Saturday at Yankee Stadium before the Red Sox play New York.

item.dc:creator: Joe Schad
item.title: Adviser: San Francisco 49ers receiver Michael Crabtree ready to sit out, re-enter draft in 2010
item.description: Receiver Michael Crabtree is prepared to sit out this season and re-enter the NFL draft in 2010, David Wells, Crabtree's cousin and adviser, said Thursday.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Major League Baseball fines Prince Fielder, Guillermo Mota; no suspensions
item.description: Prince Fielder and Guillermo Mota have been fined for their run-in this week.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Philadelphia Phillies general manager: J.A. Happ won't go to bullpen to make room for Pedro Martinez
item.description: Phillies general manager Ruben Amaro Jr. says J.A. Happ won't go to the bullpen to make room for Pedro Martinez.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Atlanta Falcons receiver Harry Douglas out for season with knee injury
item.description: Atlanta Falcons receiver Harry Douglas is out for the season after suffering a knee injury.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Steve McNair to be honored by Tennessee Titans with No. 9 helmet decal
item.description: The Tennessee Titans will honor slain former quarterback Steve McNair by wearing a No. 9 decal on their helmets this season, starting with this weekend's Hall of Fame Game against the Buffalo Bills.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: With targets on backs, Florida Gators begin fall practice
item.description: Defending national champion Florida opened fall practice Thursday with hopes of winning a third title in four years.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Vlad powers homer-happy Angels past ChiSox
item.description: Vladimir Guerrero hit his first home run in more than a month and Bobby Abreu, Jeff Mathis and Erick Aybar also went deep, sending the Angels to a 9-5 victory over the White Sox.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Minor league pitcher Julio Castillo sentenced to 30 days in jail for injuring fan with throw
item.description: A judge has ordered a minor league pitcher to serve 30 days in jail and three years' probation for injuring a fan when he threw a baseball during a melee in Dayton last year.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Jeremy Roenick retires from NHL after 20 years
item.description: Jeremy Roenick made it official, announcing his retirement as an NHL player after 20 years in the league.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Cleveland Indians owner Paul Dolan says team projected to lose $16 million, defends trades
item.description: Cleveland Indians owner Paul Dolan projects the team will lose $16 million this season and says the recent trades of Cy Young winner Cliff Lee and All-Star catcher Victor Martinez were necessary long-term moves.
